original: FRESTADIUS, Harald Sixten, Grosshandlare, Stockholm, f Sthlm 13/7 81 av dir O F o Anna Fröberg, gm Tora Bagge. Schartaus, språkstud i Tyskl o Engl. Kamr v Bergsunds Mek Verkst AB :s centralkont 00—14. Ag, vkst dir o styr.led Bertil Borgenstierna & Co AB Sthlm sed. 14 (omb f AB Bofors 14—32, Kohlswa Jernvk, Blombacka AB, AB Ferrum mfl), gr 09, AB 22. Halvdeläg i fastigh Kungs-holmsg 8 Sthlm, ag fabr.byggn i Hagaström. Styr.led i KMK. Upprep resor i Norge, Danm, Finl, Tyskl, Engl, Frankr, Schweiz, Ital, Ryssl. Led Ste örjens Gille, Sthlms Köpm.klb, KMK, KAK mfl; en av gr av Sv Grossistfrb. Borgare i Sthlm. Hobbies: Sjösport, jakt.
translated: FRESTADIUS, Harald Sixten, Merchant, Stockholm, born in Stockholm on July 13, 1881, son of director O F and Anna Fröberg, married Tora Bagge. Schartaus, language studies in German and English. Chamberlain at Bergsunds Mek Verkst AB's central office from 1900-1914. Managing director and board member of Bertil Borgenstierna & Co AB in Stockholm since 1914 (previously employed by AB Bofors from 1914-1932, Kohlswa Jernvk, Blombacka AB, AB Ferrum, and others). Founded a business in 1909 and established AB in 1922. Co-owner of property Kungsholmsgatan 8 in Stockholm, owns a factory building in Hagaström. Board member at KMK (Chamber of Commerce). Regular trips to Norway, Denmark, Finland, Germany, England, France, Switzerland, Italy, and Russia. Member of Ste örjens Gille, Stockholm's Merchants Club, KMK, KAK, and others; one of the founders of the Swedish Wholesale Association. Citizen of Stockholm. Hobbies: Water sports, hunting.

structured.name: Harald Sixten Frestadius
structured.description: Harald Sixten Frestadius was a Swedish merchant born on July 13, 1881, in Stockholm. He was the son of O F and Anna Fröberg, and he married Tora Bagge. Harald studied languages, specializing in German and English at Schartaus. From 1900 to 1914, he worked as a chamberlain at Bergsunds Mek Verkst AB's central office. In 1914, he became the managing director and board member of Bertil Borgenstierna & Co AB in Stockholm. Previously, he was employed by AB Bofors, Kohlswa Jernvk, Blombacka AB, AB Ferrum, and others. Harald founded his own business in 1909 and established AB in 1922. He was also a co-owner of the property Kungsholmsgatan 8 in Stockholm and owned a factory building in Hagaström. Harald was an active member of various organizations including KMK, Ste örjens Gille, Stockholm's Merchants Club, KAK, and one of the founders of the Swedish Wholesale Association. He took regular trips to Norway, Denmark, Finland, Germany, England, France, Switzerland, Italy, and Russia. Harald Frestadius was a citizen of Stockholm.

career.industry: Various (including AB Bofors, Kohlswa Jernvk, Blombacka AB, AB Ferrum)
